casebody.data:
Crawford vs. The State of Georgia. 1. Where an indictment charged a defendant with “breaking and entering the depot of the Savannah, Florida and Western railway, a corporation chartered by said state, doing business under said name,” the allegation that the owner was a corporation chartered by said state was mere surplusage and need not be proved. 1 Bish. Crim. Proc., §§234-3; 3 McLean, 333; 3 T. Rep., 311; 30 Ga., 591. Speer, Justice.

2. The verdict is supported by the evidence.
